text: On tap at As Is. Pours a cloudy yellow amber. Aroma is damp, grass, wood, oak, mild hops. Very interesting. Medium to high bitterness. Incredibly smooth finish. Medium bodied. Very smooth and gulpt. Excellent.

Pours hazy apple gold into a shaker. Bright white head with good retention recedes to coat surface. Pineapple, weed and mango aromas. Soft with sweet caramel and dough upfront turning to passion fruit and mango before the lasting mild pith finish. Nice.

Poured from growler thanks ClarkVV for the mule hazy golden orange with a nice white head. Aromas of tangerine pineapple citrus floral notes light malt. Taste is amazing wonderful mouthfeel balanced notes between malt citrus hops. I could drink this all the time.
Very, very smooth and extremely crushable. Balanced on a knifes edge, though perhaps not as hop pungent as I would like, it is still an exceptional big IPA.

11th April 2017. On tap at Mekelburg's in Brooklyn. Pours opaque orange with a small head. No rentention, hardly any lacing. Aroma is clean, zesty orange pith. Taste is loaded with satsuma/super tangy unripe orange. Tangy lingering moderate bitterness. Body is full and chewy. Medium carb. Top stuff.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
user_location: The big bad LDN, Greater London, ENGLAND

text:
Pours a bright, hazed golden with a white head. Dry citra hop, orange and dandelion aroma. Super dry, citra, grassy. 

Notes: On tap at Tørst (Apr 17)

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey during the Hill Farmstead tap takeover on 4/1/2017. Not an April Fools Joke. Hazy orange with off-white head. Aromas of tropical fruit, citrus, floral, pine. Tastes of citrus, pine, tropical fruit, floral notes, garlic. Medium body with a dry finish. Great stuff, enjoyed it more than the Double Nelson.

Growler. Totally opaque creamy gold-yellow pour with a white head. Aroma is fruity and creamy, mango, pineapple, some soft citrus. Taste is rich and fruity, thick body, slightly tangy with tropical fruit and a touch of mandarin orange. Really nice.

Draught. Pours a cloudy, opaque, orangey, straw yellow with a large, foamy white head. Aroma is floral hops, grapefruit, and pine. Taste is dough, grapefruit, mango, orange, and a touch of pine. Very bitter finish. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Pillowy, creamy mouthfeel.

Got in a BIF from Roguer. 750 ml swing top growler into signature tulip glass, best before 3/25/2017. Pours very hazy golden orange color with a 1-2 finger dense white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Awesome webby soapy lacing clings around the glass. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of huge tangerine, orange juice, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, guava, berries, lemon/orange zest, light pine, honey, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic complexity and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/fruity hops and moderate bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of huge tangerine, orange juice, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, guava, berries, lemon/orange zest, light pine, honey, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Light pine/grassy/citrus peel bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of tangerine, orange juice, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, guava, berries, lemon/orange peel, light pine, honey, bread, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/fruity hops and moderate bready malt flavors; with a fantastic malt/bitterness balance, and zero lingering hop astringency after the finish. Slight dryness from lingering bitterness, lightly increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and medium-plus body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready, and lightly silky/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. Slight resin/rinds near the end of the glass. Zero warming alcohol for 8%. Overall this is a world class DIPA! All around insane complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical/fruity hops and moderate bready malt flavors; very smooth and easy to drink for the ABV, thanks to the smooth/mellow bitterness. Super dank, juicy, and vibrant on hop flavors; great malt balance without feeling sweet or heavy for the ABV. An absolutely mind blowing offering.

From 750 ml growler at home. Thanks Anton! Hazy yellow orange color with nice white head. Hoppy and light malty aroma, grass, light floral, light pine, citrusy fruity, stone fruits and tropical fruits, some whet notes. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily body with soft carbonation.
UPDATED: SEP 27, 2016 750ml growler pour. Pours thick and deep orange. Delicious juicy DIPA. Smooth and long lasting flavor. Tons of citrus, grapefruit, mango and orange. Wonderful
Pine and some booze. Lots of lime peel. Hazy orange pour with good head and lacing. Light bitter finish. Very nice but not among their best. Tap at Rattle n Hum.

Growler fill. The pour is a slightly hazy orange. The aroma has a little funk to the nose. The taste is very good, a really good blend in the hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Armsby Abby: This one poured a hazy orangish golden color. There was a small off-white head that left a little lacing. Really nice nose. Citrus and tropical notes. The taste is very good. Citrus, some tropical flavors, subdued bitterness, a touch of tartness and a bit of dryness in the finish. Incredibly smooth. Very nice.

Tap at the Jeffrey to start 4th of July weekend off correctly. Slight hazy orange yellow with white foamy head. Nose is bright citrus and dank hops. Tastes of mango, grapefruit, pineapple, green grapes, lemon zest and light white pepper. Semi sweet and semi bitter. Good stuff

Growler: The aroma consists of light-moderate tropical fruits, citrus, and mild dank hops. It pours a dull hazy orange with a small white head that fades to a minimal film outlined by a thin ring. The flavor starts with moderate tropical fruits, mild citrus, and mango. The finish has light-moderate grapefruit, mild lemon peel, and dank hops. Its light-medium bodied with mild carbonation.
Shared growler at Aarons. Hoppy nose and body full of flavor and citra. Light.

Growler 750ml au Québec Ratebeer Gathering. Couleur dorée voilée, mousse blanche. Arôme dagrumes, houblon résineux, touche doignons, mangue. Goût de melon, agrumes, houblon résineux, malt. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen.

A hazed golden ale with a thin white head. In aroma, nice fruity biscuit malt with resinous floral hops, grapefruit pulp, light tropical fruits, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity biscuit malt with fruity esters, mandarin pulp, light tropical fruits, very nice and refreshing. Growler at ratebeer Quebec gathering.

On draft at the source. This is a high quality DIPA from HF that shows off Citra hops very nicely. But, Ive always found it to be a little bit over-hyped and under-flavored. As good as it is, I much prefer Double Galaxy.

On draft at Prohibition Pig. The pour is a darker foggy golden yellow with a thicker white head that falls down to a thin collar leaving lots of lace. The aroma is incredibly juicy. Lots of dank citrus and a bright juiciness to the hops. They dont really pop, but its really good. The flavor is excellent. Bright juiciness right up front. Citrus for days and a beautiful light bitterness due to the hops. Its crisp and light, but thorough. The mouth feel is a bit thick and creamy with a softer carbonation and a lingeringly juicy hop finish. This is excellent.

Sample at Prohibition Pig with koleminer20. Aroma is juicy, tropical fruit, pine, citrus, good. Appearance is golden amber, white head, hazy. Taste is juicy, tropical fruit, bitter, tons of pine, citrus, great stuff. Mouthfeel is medium body, light crisp carbonation, tons of bitter juice in the aftertaste. Overall, yowza. Top notch.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Light hazy dark golden pour with a frothy head. Notes of pine sap, grape fruits, smooth, green apples and a medium bitterness.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Pours hazy orange with an off white head. Aroma of mandarin, nectarine, mandarin peel, ripe citrus, tropical fruits, citrus candy and hop pallets. The taste is bitter, juicy and fresh. Very crispy and dank with a clean citrus hop profile. Sweet grapefruit, orange, mandarin and mango is there as well. Awesome!

Draft @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy golden pale orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity citrus hoppy piney bitter aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter piney finish.

Draught. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Some pepper notes. Heavy bitter long finish. Creamy palate. Ok but not fantastic.
Very sweet fruits on the aroma. Hazy yellow with a White head. Taste is medium bitterness and light sweetness. Bitter finish and medium sweetness. Solitude #5 was a bit better.
Tap at mikkeller and friends, copenhagen. Hazy orange color, white head. Fantastic aroma has mango, fruits, hops, some pineapples. Balanced rich hoppy taste, tropical fruits. Great iipa.

Draught. Amber coloured. Unclear, dense beige head. Aroma. Trop fruits. Flowers, sweetness, spice. Flavour. Tropical fruits, caramel, spice flowers, grape. Med to full bodied. Ends flowery bitter and grapy

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Aarhus. Pours hazy orange with a big white head. Aromas of citra (oh wow), fresh citrus, light resin, pineapple, peachy, sweet orange. Taste is citrussy, piney, light sweet, light malty, sweet orange, mango, peach.

From tap at Mikkeller Bar. Hazy orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, peach, citrus, spice and caramel.

Tap @Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade. Pours light murky yellow with a small, staying, creamy white head. Aroma has zesty lemon, hops oils, sweetish malts, light pepper. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good malty sweetness, crisp, some oat character to it, good hops, light herbal among the citrus. Heavy lingering bitterness. Nice.

08-APR-2016, draft @Mikkeller & Friends, side-by-side with Society & Solitude 5.
Hazy, Golden with a huge, lasting. laicng, foamy, White head.
Aroma is citrus, grape fruit, flowers, peach.
Taste the same. Not a lot of malt taste. Some sweetness from the malt but no way cloying. This is more like a sweet IPA than an IIPA. Fresh one though.

New york
Yelloe hazy white head.
Aroma of citrus and citra
Taste sweet, bitter almond and citrus

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Victoriagade. Cloudy golden colour with an amber tint. Fruity aroma with citrus, peaches, pale malts, grasses, bitter fruitiness and pines. Taste is bitter. Medium to full body with a creamy texture and an average carbonation. Finishes dry and bitter with citrus fruits and lingering peaches and pale malts. Benchmark IIPA.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma of intens citra, almost tropical sweet. Hazy amber with white head lasting. Taste is smooth heavy bitterness and light to dry sweetness. Full body, oily smooth feel, light carb., long citrus bitter finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Orange and hazy with medium white head. Nice lacing. Aroma of sweet fruits, citrus, oranges, berries and a hint of rubber... Sweet taste with notes of lime, fruits, candied grapefruit, bittersweet aftertaste. Full body and fizzy carbonation.

Quick notes from the HF tap takeover @mikkellerbar Aarhus. Nose has compact citra, danky and semi sweet hoppy notes.
The taste is sweet with mouthcoating hops and a perfectly bitter finish. Mellow hoppy and juicy aftertaste. Really great.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Hazy amber colored with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, citrus and pine needles with notes of caramel.
Fruity flavor of hops and grapefruits with notes of citrus and caramel.
Dry hoppy finish.

On tap at Mikkeller bar Aarhus. Pours a hazy orangy amber with a medium sized, long lasting, white head. Aroma has, oh well - guess what, citra hops! Sweet, orangy fresh citra hops, light malty sweetness, lots of tropical fruits like mango, pineapple, peaches, citrus peel. Taste is medium sweet, hoppy, juicy, fruity, medium bitter. Medium carbonation, oily texture. Tasty beer, super fresh!

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is citrus, grapefruits, lemon zest, oranges, pineapple, tropical fruits and resin. Taste is medium+ bitter and medium sweet. Medium to full bodied, hop oily texture, average carbonation. Finish is well-balanced, citrus and slightly resinous.

duft: citra citrus lidt tropisk frugt.
smag: citrus svag sødme appelsin lidt svag bitterhed citrus mellem fylde
On tap at Mikkeller Bar Barcelona. Hazy orange colour with white head. Caramel, resinous and tropical aroma. Sweet, caramel, resinous, tropical fruits, bitter taste. Medium to full body.

Tap. Hazy, deep golden with a small, lacing off-white head. Aroma of citrus, peach, apricots and flowery notes. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and bitter. Medium bodied, fat oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice DIPA indeed. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Keg. Unclear golden, medium sized white head. Dry flowers, citrus, wood, onion, basement. Full body, soft carbonation, oily texture, sweet with a rough bitter finish. Seems a bit raw to me and goes from sticky to rough bitter in a second. Not pleasant.

(20 cl on tap @ Mikkeller Bar)
Poured at fridge temperature into a Mikkeller signature glass reveals a cloudy golden body with a relatively thin, snowy white head that fades somewhat leaving lace and lots of beautiful lace. Decent regeneration. Aroma is citra goodness with some dank and resiny notes of citrus, sweat, grapefruit and a tiny weeny amount of cats urine. Once again were in the fresh, elegant and harmonious end of the DIPA scale that has served to reignite my enthusiasm for the style, which used to be turned off by the scourge of rocket fuel. Not so for this one, which retains a high degree of drinkability. Compared to the Society and Solitude this one is perhaps slightly heavier in the flavour department. Theres hop resin and a moderate driness in the finish. Still a very pleasant exposition of one of my favourite hops. The alcohol is quite well integrated into this one - probably aided by the hop resin overcoat.
Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Unclear dark yellow/orange with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, peach, tropical fruit, earthy,

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Pours hazy dark yellow with a white head, light lacing. Aroma of malt, grassy hops, bitter fruity hops, bitter citrusly hops, cats piss. Flavor is rather bitter, malt, rich fruity hops, grass, bitter citrus, grapefruit, light alcohol. Medium to full body, average to lively carbonation, dry and lasting bitter finish. 070416

Tap mikkeller. Pours cloudy orange with a White head. Aroma of hops, resin, pine, grape, pineapple, quite sweet. Taste is rather sweet, grape, resin, pineapple, Lots of tropicL fruits. A tad too sweet. Very dry and bitter finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Unclear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - tropical fruit and citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 070416
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are rich fruity bitter hops, flowers, citrus and malt. Long bitter finish.

Pours a hazy golden orange with a white head. Fruity hop aroma with citrus, peach, pine, lemon and mango. Taste is juicy hop bite with citrus, mango and tropical fruits. Delightful mouth feel. Another lovely delicious slice of Hill heaven.

Draught at Blind Tiger. 
Pours hazy golden. 
Very hoppy taste of tropical fruit, yet balanced.

Growler to wine glass from brewery. Cloudy light golden pour. Small white head. Aroma pine, pineapple, citrus, bread. Trace of funk. Flavor is white bread, sweet Tropical fruit, medium bitter finish with lingering fruits. Chewy. Phenomenonal.
Pours a hazy pale yellow with a white lacing. The aroma is tropical fruit, orange, grapefruit, tangerine and papya

Draught at Pony Bar 10 th Avenue, NYC. Hazy golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Fruity hop aroma, peach, passion fruit, pine apples, pine, lemon juice, some mango. Hoppy pine and peach flavor, pine apples, grapes, tangerines, mango. Magic tropical hop bomb. Great body, just amazing!

750mL growler filled 3/18/22 and shared with my roomate on 3/22/16.Perfect pour shows a non-soupy, but strong amount of haze. Copper-gold and a huge, well-retained, white head.Citra in the nose, believe it or not, showing no urea whatsoever, but tons of nectarine, lemon, fresh thyme and light grapefruit. Yeah, thats about as good as it gets for citra, though theres some malt lurking not so lightly behind it. A bit of caramel, earth and bread do indeed show through. It matches the citra pretty well, though, and does seem to balance the light juicy citrus notes. Not explosively aromatic, but then thats not Shauns specialty. What it lacks in Tree House character, it makes up for in "grows-on-you" appeal. The more it warms and breathes, like almost all of his beers, the more it just screams execution.In the mouth its full of lemon, white grapefruit and a softer orange juice pulpiness. Lots of herbal and nectarine dryness, with a fair amount of caramel-tinged honey. At times I think it gets too malty/sweet but my roomate points out that she likes the sweetness and that it makes it easier to drink. Coming from a wine drinker, thats an interesting observation. In some respects, it does make the hoppiness easier to bear, and theres no lack of bitterness here. Pretty cool beer, about as good as youre going to get for a citra DIPA.rotten eggs, rotten eggs,

Pours cloudy bright yellow small white head. Aroma is dank hops, pine, citrus, grapefruit, orange, mango and other tropical fruit. Taste is juicy bitter hops, orange, mango and tropical fruits. Nice smooth bitter finish. Medium body light carb. Creamy mouthfeel.

July 17, 2015. On tap at Farmhouse Tap & Grill. 
Cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is intense fruity and light dank with ripe juicy orange, grapefruit, some mango and pineapple, hints of pine and very light malty grain notes. Taste is medium sweet, juicy, soft bitter. Finish is smooth, creamy, lots of juicy oranges, mango, pawpaw, soft bitterness with just a hint of citrus pith. Medium bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation. 
Amazing, so juicy and drinkable!
First time had was 3.28.14. Dark golden pour with very little head. Smell is so many oranges. Might as well be juice. Flavor is also super juicy. Tons of grapefruit. Really just awesome.
Growler from trade with Pushkinwow, thanks man. Cloudy golden pour. Amazing citrus aroma. Hop forward but fades quickly with really great finish. Awesome stuff!
Growler shared by Tom - thanks! Hazy yellow gold pour with a white head. Awesome citrus aroma and taste. Crisp and great. Nice texture.
Hazy light yellow pour from a bomber shared by Tom - thanks!! Wonderful stuff. Nice white lacing. Massive Citra nose and taste. Excellent.

Tap at Farmhouse Tap and Grill, Burlington, VT. Soupy orange. Thin, sticky, creamy white head. Nose is all things citrus. Lots of orange and grapefruit pith, zest and juice. Background sweet, creamy malts. Taste is pithy, zesty, juicy and tangy bitter. Has a light sweetness. Smooth mouthfeel with a zingy crispness. Finishes crisp, zingy, zesty bitter. Super drinkable. All you could want in a Citra DIPA.
Growler pours thanks to Steve. Pours out a cloudy golden topped with a small head. Nose is dank hops citrus lemons. Taste is more of the dank hopsa citrus kick lots of ggrapefruit bitterness.

Growler from brewery. Pale, very cloudy, orange with a creamy white foam pillow top. A somewhat floral and very citrus forward aroma with lots of orange pulp, mango, papaya, some pinneaple, warming booziness, slightly sweet but becomes quite bitter on the finish, as everything dries out the citrus becomes more pronounced and leave you wanting another sip. Yummy.

750 mL growler. Hazy orange body. Not much of a head. Nice surface wisps. Leggy on the swirl. Nose is, surprise, lots of citra. Orange and grapefruit. A bit of sweetness.

Taste has a bit more depth. Lots of grapefruit, orange. Straightforward. Moderate sweetness. Just a hint of bitterness.
 Medium low carbonation. Slick, but low sweetness.

Very simple flavor, but great hop flavor. I definitely prefer Double Galaxy to this, though.

Draft at Black Back Pub. Pours a hazy golden orange color with a frothy off white head. Aroma is potent citra hops, a little bitter. Flavor has a wonderful juicy fleshy fruit and citrus hop character. Not bitter at all in the flavor. Wonderful mouth feel. Just fantastic overall.

Tasted on 9/24/15 from a growler, big thanks to Drews for sharing. Pours clear, light orange with a thick white head that slowly recedes to average lace. The nose is all tropical citrus hops, some floral notes, with just a bit of very light bread malt. The flavor is orange, mango, melon, a hint of bread malt, and very light bitterness. The body is medium with an oily texture, average carbonation, and a long tropical fruit and very lightly bitter orange peel finish.

Glass at Parker Pie, served in a Hill Farmstead glass . Aroma: loads of citrus and pines. App: hazy golden, minimal white head but still leaving some shy lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, resinous, crisp dry bitter finish. Overall: wow! This is just awesome! Awesome balance of dry, resinous and fruity in mouth. Not too malted as I like my IPAs. Could see drinking this for the rest of my life.

From growlers. Thx Tom10101
Pours golden with medium white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of tropical fruits, citrus,resin. Taste is the same, with bitterness indeed. Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Outstanding, packed with hops.

Thanks to a semi-retired RBian. Fresh growler. Beautiful head. Thick gold color. Green citrus is really the way to describe this. Malt balances hops. Just as perfect mix of citrus hops and green hops with not too much bitterness. No off flavors or poor hopping.

text: Draft. Hazy pale yellow color. Nice grapefruit and pineapple aroma. Taste is bitter dry lemon. Tasty.

Draft. A hazy golden beer with a lazing white head. The aroma has notes of lemons, straw, and hops on a malty background. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, hay, hops, and malt, leading to a bitter finish.

Growler pour from fill on 7-10. Pours a neon yellow color, super clouded, and big foamy white head. Aromas of tons of citrus and tropical fruits. Flavor of peach, mango, grapefruit, lemon. Really good. Medium body and a thick sticky texture. Solid carbonation and a bitter bite on the finish. Wow

Location: Pour from a two litter Hill Farmstead growler I just picked up at the brewery, 7/7/15


Aroma: The aroma is full of bright tropical and citrus hops, peach, mango, floral notes, and some light malt.  Amazing.  It really just hits all the marks of a tropical forward, hoppy beer.

Appearance: From the bulbous growler it pours a murky looking bright (like almost highlighter level) orange with a thick, frothy, white head and some lace that pretty much coats the glass.

Flavor: This one drinks really nicely with a strong tropical/fruity hop flavor, great balance. The hops shine through here with just a right on mix of the bitterness and the sweetness. 

Palate: Medium-plus bodied, with a smooth, creamy feel, soft carbonation, and a clean, dry finish.

Overall Impression: 
This is one of those beer that the more I drink the more I like. From the sample at the brewery, I thought this was my favorite of their excellent beers that were pouring that day, but Ive had a good 2+ glasses of it at this point, and know I know, this beer is an absolute knockout. The brightness of the fruity hops, the perfect cleanness of the bitterness, the smoothness of the mouthfeel, everything here is just right on. Seriously, for anyone who wonders if its worth driving out to the middle of fucking nowhere to get their beers, my answer is yes.
Draft at Positive Pie. Incredible aromas of citrusy hops and grain. Soft body, citrus, tropical fruits, bitter finish, fantastic!

Tasted from draft. Pours a cloudy yellow with nice white head. Phenomenal nose. Aroma is grapefruit, lemon, pineapple and a little orange. Taste is moderately bitter with a nice malt backbone. A little more bitterness on this then some of the other Hill Farmstead IPAs as well as not as creamy a mouthfeel as some. Flavors of citrus and tropical fruits with some pine and cracker malt notes. Definitely one of the best imperial IPAs I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy gold. Light white head and lace. Citra scent. Body is a little sticky. Smooth citra taste. Only a hint of alcohol.

Pour moi, le mot «Bonheur» - avec un B majuscule, rime avec «Double Citra». Growler rapporté de lendroit et dégusté le lendemain avec Ju-Lo et Dominique; cette bière sublimissime est le témoin du début de nos vacances estivales! Couleur jaune doré, teint éclatant - voire scintillant, tout de cette bière est spectaculaire pour lensemble des sens (sauf peut-être pour louïe). La mousse - cette mousse blanche comme neige qui sagrippe à mon verre nen finit pas de dessiner des dentelles me remplit de bonheur et témoigne dune bière onctueuse, affirmée et structurée comme peu dimpériale IPA peuvent se vanter de lêtre! En regardant le tout, je ne me rends même pas compte que machinalement, japproche mon grand nez de mon verre, comme hypnotisé. Le verre est encore à une distance dun avant-bras de mon nez quune bague de jus de mangue me fouette en plein visage. Oh là là que cest olfactif! Ça sent la mangue, la pêche, lannana... Un nez totalement enivrant! En bouche, tout est absolument exquis. En plus davoir du corps, cette bière nest pas quune explosion gratuite de houblons. On reconnaît la signature fermière et sauvage de la Maison qui manoeuvre étroitement entre les styles Saison et IPA. Pendant que Dominique reste sans voix, les yeux grands ouverts incapables de cligner, je savoure ce liquide complexe,, prodigieusement savoureux, explosif comme de la dynamite et délicat comme la soie. C,est long en bouche sans être trop amer. Lalcool nest pas. Ça goûte larc-en-ciel Le Citra est magique. Hill Farmstead est magique! Une Grande parmi les Grandes IIPA !!!

(750ml growler) cloudy medium yellow, soapy white bubbles. Nose of medium malty body, citrus zest, honey, farmhouse yeast, reminds me of the brewery. Taste is incredible, citrus zest, honey, smooth as hell, zesty finish,
Soft body, palate is perfect.

Sampled at the brewery and now drinking a growler I brought home, poured right into my brand new Hill Farmstead glass. Pours deep hazy yellow/golden, cant see through it, with a big creamy white head on top. Aroma is lots of grass and hay mixed in with both tropical and citrus fruits. Aggressive in the bitter hop notes, and this shows in the flavor as well. But as it warms it takes on a pineapple flavor alongside hay, grass, mango, and lots and lots of citrus. Dry body, very drinkable, slightly creamy, and really nice. Another winner from these guys.
Hazy lemon yellow with a small white head. Sour diesel, papaya, mango, onion, caramel malt. Light bitterness, light sweetness. Bitterness is quite lingering. A touch chewy. Big beer.
Growler from brewery. Cloudy golden, big fruity aroma - pineapple, peach, oranges. Very sweet and fruity beer, alcohol completely hidden, slight caramel malt, overall super nice.

Growler from the brewery. Pours a hazy yellow with a large foamy white head. Good head retention. Aroma of lemon, pale bready malt, tropical fruits. The taste is tropical, herbal, citrus hops, pale malt. Medium bodied, well balanced. Nice beer.

Growler from AdamJackson. Split with Douglas88. Thanks!

A: Cloudy gold/copper, foamy slightly off-whtite head. 

N: Enormous pineapple, grapefruit, with some undertones of mango and orange peel. Pine, earth, leaves, and some marijuana backed up by a cracker maltiness.

T: Quite drying, resinous, medium body, hint of alcohol, and light carbonation.

O: A tasty, very dry DIPA with a very pleasing aroma from the citra hops. Would definitely have again, and I would very much like to compare next to Hop Venom (which I like better, for now.)

Growler split at the 5/7.5/10K tasting, massive thanks to Leighton for more of this fine VT hop jus, 30/12/14. 
Hazed orange amber with a decent off white covering - a real looker of a beer.
Nose carries big citric sherbets, pine needle, tangerine, grapefruit, dank hop strokes.
Taste comprises pine, bitter citric rinds, orange pith, straw, mandarin, tangerine, apricot tang.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with juicy citric hop notes.
Super solid world class DIPA. Drinks a good bit under 8% as well!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Growler shared thanks to scotchzi! Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow with fluffy white head that dissipates to leave moderate lace. Aroma of big citrus and tropical hops over slight caramel and biscuit malt. Taste is more balanced with minimal bitterness and no sign of the abv. Just an amazing double IPA, really nice.

Growler thanks to Brandon in exchange for some rot box junk. (Definitely won that trade! ;) ) Pours a slightly hazy orange with small white head. Growler was filled a week and a half after I opened it so shouldnt be that much of an issue of freshness. Aroma is, naturally, big citrus with more on the orange peel side of things. Taste is at first slightly week for a DIPA but as it warms there is some sweetness and an overly bitter lemon/orange rind. A little thin at first on the finish but evens out ok. Ill admit that DIPAs arent really my go to anymore so Im probably judging this a few points off of what I used to. Still have to try and tick as many DIPAs as I can since it is my only shot at all 50 of a style.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Draft. Deep cloudy gold with thin white head. Huge citrus and pine Aroma. Taste adds a touch of caramel and peach. Slightly thick and sticky mouthfeel. Huge and excellent.

Growler. Cloudy yellow. Pineapple and big citrus. Smooth and big. Love this. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at HF. Poured light yellow less hazy then the rest. Aroma quite juicy citrus. Light carb med bod. Juicy taste light bitter sweet
Growler - Lots of lemon and tangerine. Cloudy gold with a light white head. Just as it smells with a dry bitter finish. Light and easy drinking, very flavourful.
Pours rather unclear blonde , no real head. Smell is very intense citra . Taste is pure citra, bitter , no malts whatsoever , citrussy finish as well . Good, not great .

Arômes dorange, zeste de citron et une touche dalcool. Un parfum de fraicheur me dit darrêter de sentir et de boire! En bouche, cest un party de fruits. Tout est trop et très balancé. Le houblon citra est dominant, frais et gouteux. Des effluves dorange, citron, pamplemousse et dananas se font sentir. Un peu dastringence mais à 8% dalcool, cest plutôt normal. Lamertume est puissante avec des pointes de pin et de zeste dorange. Un autre chef-duvre de HF. Cest comme boire un jus de fruits au déjeuné. Jen boirais tous les jours.

30th December 20145 Kay, 7.5 Kay, 10 Kay Tasting. Big thanks to Leighton for this one. Hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Mild orange and hop skunk nose. Palate is airy and semi dry with good fine carbonation. Mellow and light pale malts. Big skunky hops, slightly dank. Spicy herbal bitterness. Little floral piny sweetness. Bitterish orange morphing in to peel. Light airy finish with a peel bitter linger. Nice. Very nice.

Huge thanks to Paul. Growler filled 12/18/14, shipping got damaged the first time. Almost two weeks past the HF tag, so hopefully still good. Really cloudy golden yellow. Smell is bitter hoppy orange juice. Taste has orange citrus, almost like you are drinking fresh OJ pulp without the pulpy mouthfeel. Slightly bitter, slightly sweet. A very good IPA, but not the best from HF.

Catching up on older ratings from notes. From growler shipped in from the Northeast at a bottle share at Upsons house on November 9, 2014. Pours a very hazy golden brown with clingy white foam. AROMA has strong tangerines along with tropical fruits and soapy hops. FLAVOR of bitter citrus, grapefruit, and more tropical fruits. Dry and only mildly bitter. Quite good but not as nuanced as I might have hoped (the HF Abner was certainly the better DIPA). (170, 938)

Growler thanks to main HF hook-up L-Dogg. It pours cloudy yellow with a thick white head. The nose is soft, juicy, fruity, orange, tangerine, grapefruit, Five Alive fruit juice and orange blossom. The noses is crisp, bitter, juicy, orange, peachy, apricot, straw, tangerine, straw, grass, light pepper and spice with a smooth, dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Crisp, balanced and crazy-drinkable!

Growler courtesy of Ley-tone. Deep gold with a small head. Nose is orange peel, flowers, dank tropical undergrowth. Sea salt. Taste is orange and lemon. grassy. Nimble and fresh. Active carbonation. Fun.

Growler from Hill Farmstead. Pours a vibrant golden/orange color, two finger white head. Aromas how tropical fruits...mango/peach/tangerine...along with a citrus punch of orange/lemon. Taste has a nice initial blast of the hops bouquet, but the finish has a much more pronounced bitterness than I expected. A bit zesty with notes of alcohol peeking through. Still, a very solid offering.

On tap @ Beachwood Brewing. Hazed golden pour with a white head. The nose is super dank and citrus. Pineapple, some grapefruit rind, and orange marmalade. Super fragrant. Flavor is a touch on the sweet side, but does have a lot of pine bitterness. Theres a good fruity pineapple and peach note. Fairly resinous finish. Pretty juicy.

Growler @ Another Tasting, courtesy of kermis. Thnx for sharing dude! Pours a hazy golden beer with a nice, medium sized white head on top. Aroma is Citra all over.. massive citrus influences, obviously, thats basically all Im getting. This beer smells exactly how its supposed to be. Flavor is very nice bitter, loads of citric bitterness going on, grapefruits, lemon. Amazing well balanced, great stuff from Hill Farmstead. Very well!!

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2014 Growler @ another tasting. Aroma is huge, and I mean huge, Citra, like opening a fresh vacuum bag of Citra, massive citrus. Intense. Flavour is creamy citric citrussy Citra madness. Bunch of other stuff. Whatever. Wow.

Bottle at Another Tasting, hosted by MrHangover. Hazy yellow pour. Aroma is very full of citra hops, tropical, melon, lychee and spicy. Flavor is smooth, creamy, sweet and bitter. Great balance. Very powerful brew.

Fresh growler shared at Another Tasting. Pours very hazy dull golden orange with an off white head. Aroma is super dank, massive citra as expected, Im getting massive melons from this. Flavor is light to moderate sweet and over moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Superb!

Aroma: Piney, Veggie, Mild Citrus

Appearance: Golden Straw Hue, Passes Lots of Light, Thin White Head Ring, Mild Lacing

Taste: Citrus, Veggie

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Drying, Mildly Bitter

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2015 Growler from the brewery. This beer is up there with the best DIPAs I have ever had. Pours a cloudy right orange with a slight reddish tinge to it. Fluffy white head. Aromas of orange, tropical fruits, and pretty significant doses of cantelope. Very melony. Taste was slight bitterness, soft finish. Super drinkable. Juicy.

If you like IPA, DIPA, Pale Ales, then you like this. Period. 

Growler from HF. Hazy gold with white frothy head. Aroma is hay, pine, orange zest, lemon, tangerine. Taste is the same. Crisp and light on the palate. Quick refreshing finish. I want gallons.

Holy citrus! And as dank as can be. Upon opening the growler there is a pungent aroma of grapefruit/citrus and hops. The pungent smell is followed right up with the taste. This beer rivals them all and in my personal opinion beats out my long time favorite heady topper.

On tap at the Reservoir: Pours hazy straw with a one finger head. Aroma is all citrus all day. Lots of grapefruit, orange zest, and bready malt notes. Taste is a complete citrus bomb, so much grapefruit and tropical fruits. Medium body, soft carbonation, incredibly tasty. I love it.

750ml growler from the source, brought back by Dan P.! Thanks bro! Shared this with my wife on date night (I think this may have converted her to a craft beer drinker!! She loves it!!) Pours a cloudy straw color with a finger of frothy white head. Aroma is insane! Peach, pineapple, grapefruit, melon, and bready malts. Taste isnt as impressive, but is still top notch! Taste mimics the nose, with some sweet pineapple juice, and bitter citrus skins in the finish.
UPDATED: FEB 12, 2015 Growler. Pours yellow gold white head. Nose/taste of citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruit, cracker malt. Medium body.
Growler. Yellow pour with white head. Super citrus, grassy and fruit hop aromas. Flavors follow sweet and fresh hop.
Bright yellow/orange. Nose is juicy hops, skunky, well water. Taste is super juicy hops, balanced bitterness, orange, slightly tangy finish, just so smooth and clean.

Purchased at the source. $13 for the 750 mL growler. Consumed with Airfocehops and jcwattsrugger at my pad with annoying dog rubbing on our knees. To long-stemmed white wine glass, it pours a deep safety orange with which a whitish fluffy head 1 finger in length stood. Aromas of pistachios, tangerine peels, sour grass, cotton, sweat, wet spring grass, edamame, mint, Oceanic hops, bay leaves, dried lavender, white sage, and American yeast. Tastes the same with the addition of plastic, spent grain, juniper berries, and coconut meat. Wow! What a delicious DIPA!
Taster at the source. Pours pale orange gold with an off white head. Amazing lime orange citrus and wet cracker aroma. Flavor follows nose, slightly woody and not as amazing as the nose.

Tap at Hill Farmstead. Hazed banana peel pour, large white head. Intense tropical fruit aromas. Really complex and stimulating/deep nose, probably the nicest smelling beer Ive ever had. Taste is semi sweet and lightly bitter. Flavors of straight up tropical hop fruit juice. Never before have I tasted such a beautiful expression of a single hop. Amazing. Best dipa Ive ever had.
amazing nose which spoke of its taste prior to drinking, hazy farmstyle beer which likely exceeds IBU which can be determined by a human, life changing brew

4/VII/14 - 75cl swing top bottle @ De Hopduvel (Gent) - BB: 1/VII/14 (2014-694) Thanks to Bobochamp for sharing the bottle!
Little cloudy dark blond to light orange beer, small creamy white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: fruity, grains, hoppy, bit cheesy, citrus, grassy, hay, some cow fodder. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: sourish start, citrus, soft bitterness, peaches, some exotic fruits, bit of grains, grapefruit. Aftertaste: some citrus, exotic fruits, bit piny, sourish, grapefruit, some alcohol.

Bottle 750 ml, shared by Tom10101, thanks! This one, as its name suggests, is all about citra hops, and of course, we dont complain! The perfect mix of resinous and citrus is there for our enjoyment, as this beer is not only very good, but also extremely refreshing!

75cl growler, fresh batch (best consumed by 7/01/2014), no mention of ABV, new exclusive American brew Anno 2011, thx alot to Secret Santa for bringing this over!, very complex bitter brew, fruity/bitter and slightly woody/malty, very balanced, cloudy, rocky head, very good brew, yet expensive!

Growler from the latest release. Pour is somewhat hazy peach with a soapy white head. Nose is kind of oddly muted citra hops, not faded or old, just sort of restrained. Grain and a sort of odd savory note, not unpleasant. Mouth is more to form, focused hop bite at the front with bitter citrus and a light sweet touch, then a bit more of that savory note thats Thai-like (lemongrass)? Pretty good, not on the level of the Heady Topper I just drank.

Got this growler via trade. First Hill Farmstead beer ever!! Pours hazy golden with a medium head a good lacing. Quality piney hop aroma with slight hints of citrus. The taste is wonderfully smooth with piney citrus flavors shining through. The mouth feel is somewhat creamy and leaves a great hop taste on the palate. A wonderful IPA that is incredibly smooth and refreshing. Can't wait to visit the brewery! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,75 bottle bought at the brewery. More than two hours in line on saturday. Thanks to Russel for his patience and driving. Pours out unclear pale golden, small head. A lot of hopy mango and grapefruit on the nose. Starts with bitter grapefruit. Later malty, light bitter mango in the background. Nice aftertaste with hints of hay. But sorry guys, be honest, it´s overrated.
750ml growler. Hazy yellow with a frothy white head. Flavors are grapefruit, mango, lychee and sweet malts with resinous and floral notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

2oz pour at the brewery. Pours a hazy orange with some very frothy, white head. Nose has plenty of citrus, some orange zest, some lemon, a distinct white grape character, some malt sweetness, a little honey comb, a little pine. Flavor is the same, a distinct white grape character, almost a little like a Viognier, plenty of citrus too, orange, grapefruit, some malt too, some pine. Lightly sweet, bitter finish. Call me crazy, but this didnt make me swoon. Very nice, but may be a bit hyped.

Very very solid beer. Light balanced citrus aroma. Hoppy Citrus and sweet initial taste that fades away on the palate very nicely. You can drink a ton of this but you dont because the taste is to be savored. Just a perfectly balanced beer. This is up there with Boneyard dipa in quality of taste.

Growler thanks to Mark. Nose is a ton of tropical mango dank, classic citra. Pour is slightly hazy light orange with medium sized head. Taste is like a fruit cup explosion. Barely any boost taste. A simple, straight forward perfectly balanced DIPA.

Growler share thanks to Homer321. Fairly hazy orange color, off white head. Lots of citrusy hop character, grapefruit, fruity, sweet aroma. Lots of citrusy hop flavor as well, well balanced malt backbone, tasty, smooth.

Growler share thanks to homer321. Pours an orange color, with white head. Aroma is full citra, lots citra, did I mention citrus? Taste is citrus crazy too, almost abut bitter with the fruit notes. Light bodied, hides the boost really well. Could drink all day, very yummy.

Draft (growler). Pours murky orange with thin white head that lingers. Sweet grapefruit aroma over mild carbonation. Medium complex hop flavor but not over zealous. Citrus, grass and lemon. A tad bit boozy but not distracting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler from kfarrell7, thanks. Hazy yellow body with a large white head. Aroma is citra, hops, tropical fruit, pineapple. Flavour is citra, hops, grass, tropical fruit, pineapple. Nice bitter aftertaste. Oily texture leaving nice lacings. Medium carbonation. Clean and crispy. Pure deliciousness. I wish I lived close to Hill Farmstead!
Had this at a share from a friend. Poured a nice golden rod. Citra, citra, citra on the nose. Pine and grass on the palate, with a little citrus and just enough malt. Very clean and dry finish.

Growler thanks to Will. Pours a cloudy orange with thick white frothy head. The aroma is strong citra, grapefruit, tropical notes. Medium mouthfeel with strong citra hop and light bitterness, easy to drink, wow, really enjoyed this one.

Growler: Thanks, Alex! Super murky, radiant yellow body with a soapy, foamy, bone-white head on top. Aroma is just as youd expect... Explodes with citrus peel, orange zest, grapefruit shavings, mild peppery & herbal leaf notes, faint lemon, & a back-end hint of some dankness & grassy, green onion. Barely any malt to speak of, a hint of distant bread, maybe. Some of that cracker malt in the flavor up front, but dont be mistaken - this thing is all about the hops. Dry, weedy hops, crisp orange peel, grapefruit flesh, tangerines, light guava & tropical notes join the citric ruckus, hint of mango. Back-end shows more of the herbal, white pepper coated hop leaves, cut grass, faint green onion... Just a kiss of sugar cookie malt sweetness. Balance? No. This is hop crazy, but its lovely. Alcohol is barely detectable. Another great DIPA from Hill Farmstead.

On tap @ the brewery. Pours cloudy orange with thick head, good retention and lace. Aroma is huge... Citrus hop / citrus fruit, grass, light pine. Taste is gooey orange juice, grass, citra hop, leaves a bitter juicy hangover in your mouth, solution: hair of the dog. Brilliant stuff, incredibly smooth + juicy mouthfeel.

At my place with Taylor, Matt, and Jake. Pour is neon orange, thin which head. Aroma is citric floral hops, some fruit. The medim bitterness that blends with the citric fruity notes, beautiful, melon.

750 ml growler thx Heather and Frank shared with jf A: grapefruit, tropical , citrusy App: hazy pale thick white head. T/p: thin to med body moderate long bitter finish.o: smells so good. Like the texture. Citra is my favorite hop ...what a threat.

On tap at Blackback Flyshop and Taproom, Vermont. Appearance is cloudy apple juice. Aroma is fruit bomb, citra hop poppin out. Taste is bitterness, hops, resin, fruit. Lovely, but only wish it lingered on the palate a little longer; finish is almost too clean. Good double.

For what its worth, I had this immediately following Heady Topper and this is hands down a better beer to me. It pours cloudy golden w/ a scant white head. Its sweet w/ a soft hop character--lots of pine and citrus. Its medium to full bodied but not overly sweet, which can be a problem for this style. This is definitely a huge beer but its still quite drinkable and nice.
A typically excellent and clean HF pale ale with some good tropical fruit character and a really neat malt profile.

Pour is hazed golden yellow with a fairly tight white head. Nose has a light grain up front with grapefruit and citrus, faint pine and a touch herbal. Taste is fruitier and the citra is much more pronounced. Lots of tropical fruits and mango finishing with some lightly bitter grapefruit and notes of hop resin. Body is a bit fuller and softer carbonation. Soft and a touch grainy.
Great DIPA, thanks for the half growler John. Aroma is pure tame citra hop. Cloudy head. Hop right there and not overwhelming, lemon and orange.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2014 On tap at Blackback Pub 3/22/13. Pours a hazy straw, almost looks like a mimosa or a wheat. Thin white head that leaves loose lacing. Nose is citrus through and through, almost acidic. Taste is citrus, acidic, grapefruit juice aftertaste, bright, floral, great. My first solely citra beer and Im impressed. Overall awesome. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[5257-20130426] Tap. Mild white wine notes in the aroma. Hazy, light orange yellow body with a long-lasting creamy white head. Bitter lemon yeast flavour has a great bitter bite through to the finish. Medium body. Fresh, delicious, dangerously drinkable. (8/5/9/4/18) 4.4
(@ brewery, Greensboro, VT)

750 ml growler shared with the group (July 2012). Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor had sticky citrus, grapefruit, some tropical notes, caramel, bready malts, some resiny notes. Medium bodied. You cant go wrong with anything that they are doing.

Growler from the brewery. Pours cloudy gold with a foamy white head. Tons of rich citrus in the nose, orange, grapefruit, mango, melon. Medium to big sweet flavor, some lightly bready pale malts, hints of tangy lemon, more pithy orange and grapefruit. Medium to full bodied with fine, massaging carbonation. Light sticky and pithy citrus fruits in the finish, melon, tangerine, grapefruit, orange. Delicious stuff. Rich and well balanced.

Growler thanks to my man, Corey! Hazy orange pour with a frothy white head that leaves layers of lace. Massive, bright tropical citrus, grapefruit, pineapple aroma coming out of the growler before I even pour it and it just grows as its being poured. Flavor is juicy citrus throughout with great balance without being noticeably sweet. Clean, medium bodied and a bitter finish. Absolutely fantastic.
This beer is not quite as complex as the Abner or Heady Topper but my gawd its delicious. If you like citrus tasting IPAs then you may find this one to be the best youve ever had!

Pours a cloudy yellow with a medium white head that leaves good lacing... the classic Hill Farmstead looks I must say. Aroma is dank and piney, really potent. Taste is a fine balance between sweet and bitter. Medium bodied, good carb for an "old" growler. Great!

Growler 750mL. Merci Sam! Dorée trouble. Nez intense et superbe de zeste de citron et pamplemousse blanc. Bouche longue sur le pamplemousse blanc et les fruits tropicaux. Astringente en finale. Superbe!

Growler courtesy of Cparles.

Poured a hazy orange with a whisp of cloudy head. 

Smell is everything I could imagine wanting a DIPA to smell like. Orange pith and grapefruit.

Taste was citrusy,lots of sticky piney hops with a spicy after note. Refreshing and refined. One of the top DIPA ive had from HF or anybody

750 ml growler. Huge thanks to Tom again! Pours a cloudy gold color with a medium foamy head that fades nicely to a ring. Leaves some nice oily lacing, I always love the appearance of HF beers. Aroma is an assault of citra hops, more than any other citra IPA Ive had. Light mustiness with oranges, grapefruit, lime, and tropical fruit. Tastes like chewing on citra hops, so much citrus and tropical fruit. Very light sweetness and moderate bitterness. Smooth and oily. Another awesome DIPA from HF but I still think I like Abner and Ephraim better.

En fût et growler de 750 ml. Arômes frais et fruités de houblons américains (pamplemousse rose, orange confite, ananas). Robe orangée et trouble, légère dentelle, effervescence moyenne et texture très veloutée. En bouche, le houblonnage se montre remarquablement frais et fruité, portant surtout sur des notes dagrumes. Le malt est velouté sans être sucré. Légère présence dalcool en finale et amertume assez délicate pour le style. Une merveilleuse DIPA, qui na cependant pas la complexité de leur Abner.

From 10/25 notes. 750ml growler purchased at the brewery 10/23, drank two days later. Pours hazy yellow gold with 1 finger head. Nose is citrus aromas that blend together, some lemon, lime, grassy notes. Mouthfeel is rich, malty with a good balance of carbonation. Taste is big lemon, orange, very hoppy but balanced, some fruit, apricot, some faint pine, wheat, restrained. Finish is clean bitterness with sweet doughy honey notes, some citrus notes, complex. Wonderful.

Liter bottle from the brewery. Pours foggy haze with a little head. Tastes very great with a large grapefruit finish. Very citrus.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2014 Larôme ne laisse aucun doute sur ce quon a devant nous, un citra séquestré et soumis à une minutieuse torture par la main de Shaun. Les saveurs de tangerine, ananas, mangue enduits dune résine me font saliver entre chaque gorgée. Le liquide est tout en puissance mais garde le confort et la délicatesse typique HF. Le corps est douillet avec une effervescence suave.

1 liter growler from HFS Brewery, poured on Wednesday. Bright yellow color with large lasting head that produced huge soapy lacing. The retention is crazy. The aromas in this brew are some of the best I have ever experienced in a beer. Citrus for days. Grapefruit, passion fruit and tangerine. Hints of bread malts. The flavor is simply juicy fruits. The fruits are so forward that is sweet but not cloying. Lots of hop flavors without the bitterness. Really not aggressive at all which is a marvel in itself. The flavor is truly amazing. Texture is all wet, juicy hops. I didnt feel the 8 % ABV until after the second glass, alcohol notes doesnt exist here. DAMN Mr. Hill has done it again!

75cl growler shared with Mathieu87 at home.
APPEARANCE: some fungus at the neck of the bottle noticeable, but not towards the beer.
clouded blond beer, off white stable head.
NOSE: citrus, hoppy, fruity, amazing nose!
TASTE: hoppy, quite peppery.

No head but small white rim; pale UFO-laden, fully hazy ochre-orangey beer. Exploding fruity/citrussy hoparomas on opening. Grapefruit(peel), hopoils reigning. Baked cake(bottom) with maltsweetness supporting very bitter-fruiy hopflavours. Grapefruit again most prominent. Citra squared, rather than doubled. Gets even more fruity after some time, bitterness mellowing. Light to medium bodied impression only. Little carbonisation. Nothing really spectacular, but immensely satisfying brew.  Many thanks to M & L!

Draft at Hill 3rd Anniversary. Pours a cloudy orange yellow color with a finger of foam. The nose is ripe grapefruit, citrus pith and juicy orange. The palate follows the nose with a juicy round full mouthfeel and palate pleasing citrus that flows into a bitter quenching finish. Damn this is a tasty beer !!!

tap at HF anniversary party.   notes of big juicy citrusy grapefruit, hint of resin.   definitely hop forward, but some pleasant clean toasted biscuity malts add some nice balance. tried side by side with society a solitude 6.  this had more hop bitterness.   more bright grapefruit.   nice.

Bottle [750ml] shared with HogTownHarry and GregClow. Pours a cloudy yellow-gold with an average size lasting fluffy off-white head. Aroma: Oh yeah, Citra hops galore! Tons of hops along with citrus fruit and a hint of alcohol, it smells lovely. Flavour follows the aroma and wow, this is so flavourful and the alcohol is well hidden. Medium bodied. Just awesome!

750mL growler, pours a cloudy opaque golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of various tropical fruits, citrus hops, that typical "cat piss" smell that the citra hops, and some cereal malts. Flavour is quite bitter, with citrus hops, some dry tropical fruity notes, a little grassy hop notes, and some dry cereal malts to back. Very bitter, but also wonderfully robust on the palate. Citra not being one of my favourite hops by itself, I didnt enjoy this as much as Hill Farmsteads other IIPAs; though this is exceptionally well-made and very highly drinkable. Excellent.

750ml swing-top growler shared with blankboy and GregClow, via JerCraigs.  Quite hazy orange-yellow - decent white head.  Smell and taste - citra;  juicy, some alcohol, so fruity - screw it, great beer.

Growler filled last weekend. Outrageous aroma explodes with juicy Citra hops from my glass. Gorgeous pour is par for the course for a HF DIPA: copious white head, sticky lace. Mellow bitterness up front as the hops assault my palate; big malty base balances the profile. Finishes dry and bitter. Damn good, yet still a full step behind Abner in my book.

750ml Growler shared with bytemesis - thanks for the pour Mike! Removed the swing top with a slight "pop" sound and small traces of C02 glass leaking out. Poured deep and cloudy yellow with a nice fluffy head. Right away the aroma attacks the nose with resins, some grapefruit, tangerines, citrus, pine, crackers and slight straw/hay/grass on the exhale. First few sips I swished around in my mouth and got a massive sticky resiny mouthfeel with fizzy/tingly carbonation. The bitterness sits on the tongue, but isnt overpowering, unlocking lots of grapefruit, citrusy zest, crackery malt, doughy biscuit, with that awesome dry finish. Medium-to-high carbontion but soft on the palate. The mouthfeel on Hills IPAs have yet to let me down. The lasting finishing are not too bitter, and has no astrigency. Killer lacing and decent sized legs. Very little trace of the ABV. Flavorful and delicious... I enjoyed this much better than the Double Galaxy

750 ml. growler. It pours a hazy light orange color with a tall white head. The aroma is really nice and fresh with grapefruit, pineapple, a little onion and garlic really good and nicely balanced. The flavor is wonderful with an incredibly soft mouthfeel (HF well water??) and intense hop flavor of grapefruit, pineapple, a little peach and onion spice. Very subtle and smooth bitterness. Its amazing how well this growler travelled across the country. Perfect carbonation, freshness and no signs of oxidation. Just beautiful.

Growler - thanks Del! Pours hazy yellow-amber with a medium creamy off-white head that dissipates with very nice lacing. Aroma is citrus, pine resin, a touch of passionfruit. Flavor is about the same, light sweetness, light to medium bitterness, but very controlled bitterness as compared to the flavor explosion in the mouth from the hop resins. Medium body, prickly carbonation, oily mouthfeel. Yummy.

Growler, 05/06/2013, thanks to quackus42. Pours hazy orange, creamy head settles to a nice crema on the surface, sticky lacing left around the ring of the glass. Aroma is juicy, cantaloupe, passion fruit, pineapple, tangerine, soft bread malts underneath giving a base. Taste is soft cantaloupe, tangerine and grapefruit, pulpy and juicy, nice fruity bitterness. Full, creamy palate, not sticky at all. Wow.

Growler (750 ml). Filled at the brewery 8 days ago. Unclear glowing straw color with a beautiful medium persistent white head and good lacing. Aroma is of intense tropical fruits, citrus, slight resinous notes and sweet malt. Taste is slightly to moderately sweet (never cloying) with intense tropical fruits, sweet malts, slight resinous presence and a moderate bitter finish. Medium body. Good carbonation. Dry. Very good DIPA. Extremely drinkable. Intensely hoppy aroma. Another great hoppy beer from HF.

Pours a cloudy golden, white head an good lacing. Aroma of piney hops, lots of tropical fruits, light citrus. Taste is full of tropical fruits, light citrus, faint malts (for the abv), medium body and medium carbonation. Very drinkable, delicious!

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2013 2013-05-XX. No notes. Citrus comes out even better than I remembered. +1 overall. Very nice stuff! 750ml growler from the brewery.
2013-04-26. Hazy pale orange, large white head and lace. 4+ Modest aroma, hoppy, lemon, pleasant pale malt. Flavour is the same, light pale malt, pleasant sweet malt, citrusy hops grow as it goes. 7++ Very smooth average palate has pleasantly soft carbonation. 3++ Very dangerously drinkable. Nice stuff. On tap at Hill farmstead.

Growler at home with friends. Pour is hazy golden orange with a big white head and great lacing. Super fruity, grapefruit peel, oranges, weedy, ganja, somewhat piney, and straw aroma. Taste is resinous, deep grapefruit, oranges, citrus, fruit peel, big grass & weed, sprucy, dough and a clean malt profile - straw and biscuit - with a medium bitter finish. Full body with high carbonation. Well-balanced, hoppy and a light malt backbone, yet not overly bitter or harsh. Awesome DIPA!

Hazy golden orange color, moderate white head. Grapefruit, orange, peach, mango, and grass. Initial sweetness balanced by mild hop bitterness that lingers briefly. Crisp, light-bodied, and refreshing. Small alcohol presence that is more an afterthought.

Pours from a swingtop bottle a hazy amber color with a medium thick and foamy white head that recedes slowly. Patchy lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus fruits, hops and malt. Medium-bodied with flavors of grapefruit, pineapples, hops and roast malt. The finish is fruity with a lingering citrusy hops aftertaste. Solid beer all around.

750 ml growler S: Straight up juice, tangerines, lemons, oranges, and lime but somep pine was able to sneak up in there. A: a hazy brown, orange, with about a inch head. T: againg this is just full of juice, oranges, tangerines, pineapple, and some lime. The flavors are very soft, and there is almost no noticable malt. M: Soft carbonation , a bit silky with mild bitterness. O: A very balance brew, easy to drink. This drinks like a top ranking 6% IPA. Although would perfer this to be more in your face.

Golden honey pour, thumbs worth of white head.  Rings of lacing.  Grapefruit, orange peel, lemon peel, zesty.  Taste is the same, Grapefruit, citrus peels, slightly catty (in a good way), resiny.  Medium body.  bg thanks to Dan for bringing this by to share!

Growler pour courtesy of Vinny. Pours literally glowing honey mustard yellow with a tasteful, smooth white head. Lacing is clean and spotty. Aroma is pineapple and orange zest. Taste is full of pineapple, orange, lemon, and some clean resin in the finish. Juicy upfront transitioning to pleasantly dry in the finish. This beer is fucking superb; inspired, elegant, and wonderful. Beautiful IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Un verre bien rempli avant de quitter la place avec une tonne de bières pour une délicieuse pizza du Parker Pie.  Encore une fois, un regard du tonnerre.  Un liquide bien jaune et sa tête blanchâtre qui  reste figée dans le temps.  Une inévitable dentelle qui senroule sur des kilomètres et des kilomètres.  Une fois plongé, mon nez vibre au son tropical de ce houblon que jaime et qui maime.   Des ananas, des agrumes et des mangues mûries qui réussissent à hypnotiser mes narines.  Une belle petite bouffée féline qui vient me rappeler que le Citra reste le Citra.  Des céréales bien senties mais volontairement mises de côté par mon cerveau qui salive devant cette fraîcheur houblonnée.  Une fois avalé, le houblon implose et laisse des saveurs de pamplemousse,  dorange, de mangue et de fruits que je ne cherche plus à identifier.  Je savoure le moment.  La vie est belle et mon corps est un puits sans fond.  En bouche, une autre leçon du maître Shaun.  Ceux et celles qui donnent une note inférieur à 4 sur 5 pour le palate de nimporte quelle bière de HF devraient être bannis à vie de Ratebeer et condamnés à boire pour le reste de leur misérable vie des caisses de Schoune.  Dans les derniers moments de cette dégustation, une réflexion longue sur cette finale pleine de résine et de fruits doux et la beauté des yeux rieurs de cette charmante jeune femme qui manie le tap handle comme une déesse.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2014 On tap in a tulip at the brewery.  Pours cloudy golden with a lacy, white head.  Aroma of citrus hops, resin, some floral notes, a good amount of caramel malts, and light dough.  Flavor the same.  Smooth texture.  A pretty good IPA.
Edit: Poured from a growler.  Aroma strong of citrusy and fruity and almost spicy hops.  Flavor the same.  Really good
Solid citra based ipa. Not too sweet, very nice dry finish, citrus and tropical flavors, pleasant bitterness.

750 mL Batch 2 growler, compliments of Conor, shared with Matt and Paul.

Hazy, peachy amber color with a large, dense off white head. Nice retention and lacing. 

Aroma is intensely tropical; mango, pineapple and juicy grapefruit with light alcohol and irrelevant malt. What you would expect from citra hops...

Flavor is not nearly as sweet, but still less bitterness and rind then I remember from batch 1. Strong pulp and rind balance out the juicy tropical flavors. Medium thick, chewy well-carbonated body with strong carbonation.

I like this better than batch 1, but Im still not crazy about an imperial IPA that only uses citra hops. Not particularly subtle or complex; Id rather have HF Galaxy or Abner or Edward or Ephraim...

Growler shared by yourefragile. Thanks Mike!

The beer is yellowish, on the fringes of orange. Its ever so slightly hazy, appearing clear for the most part. The head is about 1/2" thick and leaves a healthy amount of lacing behind.

The aroma tells me I am in for a treat. Tropical citrus galore, with oranges, grapefruit, mango, pineapple. Oh yeah...

All the wonderfully fresh fruit and hop flavors shine through brilliantly. Malt presence is virtually nonexistent, as it should be.

The beer is medium bodied with a creamy feel. The finish is dry, with a lasting hop bitterness. 

Superb. Highly recommended.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 06-30-2011

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2013 Growler shared by Seth.  Cloudy yellow pour with a white head.  Hoppy nose.  Pine and floral hop notes.  A little on the minerally side.  Slightly unbalanced..  Original rating 4.0
Re-rate (another growler thanks to Seth).  Enticing hop aromas.  This version was much more balanced with fantastic citrus hop notes.  Great mouthfeel and good body.

This is an outstanding brew. Pours a light amber with a thin head. The aroma is loaded with citrus and a little pine and fruit. The flavor has the citrus, pine and fruit over a nice malt profile. The finish is crisp and clean.
Draft. Hazy blonde amber with a lovely pillowy head. Citra hops shine through. Strong hop bitterness. Grapefruit pith. Cumquots. Lemon seeds. Citra through and through.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured hazy amber color with an average frothy white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Medium to heavy lemon citrus hop and resin aroma. Medium to full body with slick texture and soft carbonation. Moderate to heavy smooth bittersweet citrus flavor with a moderate to heavy bittersweet finish of average to long duration.This is a standout beer.
Pours orange with great head very fluffy. Big citrus orange aroma. Taste is very citrus slight bitter just right amount of sweet. Another good hill IPA
Looks good; light-orange with thin white lacing. Smells GREAT! Citra all the way! Fantastic! Tastes like it smells, but not quite as mind-blowing. Good on the palate too. Yes!

Growler into tulip.  Hazy gold pour with a small white head.  Nice aroma... Huge mixed citrus laced with mixed tropical fruit.  Flavor follows with a soft piney, bitterness.  The malt makes a subtle impact which I love.  This is dangerously drinkable.  I was able to quickly finish the 750mL growler.  I wish I had more!  This is up there with abner and ephraim.

Growler thanks to a trade! Pours a murky pale orange gold a near white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a nice citrus note with a hint of bitter grapefruit backed by light sweet grains. Flavor has more bitter grapefruit with notes of citrus and pine with just a hint of a grain backing.

Picked this up today at Hill Farmstead Brewery. Thanks Shaun for the very careful filling of this. Put it in the fridge and poured into a Hill Farmstead Glass (of course). Citra being my absolute favorite hop, Im excited to try this. 

A - This beer is beautiful. Subtle tangerine appearance soft and full of clouds. 2-Fingers of off-white head was formed on a slow formed. Not much lacing and subsided quickly. 

S - Alright! Grapefruit, tangerines, birch and floral notes. The citra is absolutely amazing! DOUBLE of everything great about my favorite hop.

T - This is an extremely soft beer up front. I get the fresh lemon zest, orange pulp and grapefruit rinds. Bitterness approaches fast and swift as the liquid coats my tongue and leaves behind this very meaty intense bitterness that stays alive for quite a while. The only thing to do is simple take another sip.

M - Wow. Mouth filling carbonation. 80% carbonation on the mouth swish. Light body despite the Double IPA style and dry bitter finish.

O - This beer is perfect, remarkable. I need more. Fact: I would not drink anything else if I lived closer to this brewery. 2.5 hour each way is a lot of driving. Still, Shaun never fails to impress.

Draught at TND:  Aroma of Citra hops, lemon, citrus, and hops.  Poured dark yellow/very light orange in color with a small, white head that diminished but lasted throughout as a film on top of the beer.  Cloudy.  Not sparkling.  Flavor is lightly sweet and heavily bitter.  Tastes of Citra hops, citrus, lemon, pine, resin, and hop oil.  Medium body.  Tingly, then dry and slightly chalky texture.  Average to lively carbonation.  Medium to heavily bitter, Citra hop, citrus, lemon, finish is dry.  8%ABV is completely hidden throughout.
draft at Capones. pours slightly opaque light yellow, nose is fresh cut grass and vegetal notes. first sip is nice citrus flavors,  finish is hoppy bitterness nice mouth feel.

9 oz draft at Capones. Pours hazy dark orange amber. Nose is citrus, pineapple, mango, tropical fruits with hints of dank resin. Taste is light tropical, citrus, pineapple, grass, pine with a dry and medium bitter finish. Top notch

growler, thanks kan. Pours hazed glow orange white head nose juicy hops tropical fruit clemtines, floral floral grassy floral astringent bitterness, good stuff,

Draft at Capones during PBW summer 2011.  Poured hazy coppery orange with 1-finger off-white head.  Nose is caramel malt, big mangoey resiny hops.  Tasted complex, heavily IBU-laden, with that awesome crisp peppery fruity Citra hop just juicing all over the palate.  This beer was excellent.

on tap at hill farmstead harvest festival. bright straw, slight haze, with a nice white head, good retention and lacing. loads of mangos and citrus goodness. hint of ginger, fresh, never boozy or cloying - light malted sweetness. lively and soft carbonation, medium body, silkyness, medium long citrusy finish.

Third IPA tried at the Harvest festival and all are top notch.  The citra hop is amazing and is brought to life in this one.  Huge mango flavor notes dominate and a lightly sweet nicely bittered finish.  Enjoyed every last drop of this one.
UPDATED: FEB 10, 2015 Huge tropical fruits just like zombie dust, sticky at hill farmstead tasting

Growler, thanks to GlouGlouBurp.  Had this with the Galaxy, and wish I would have cracked this one first.  Much more subtle and less bitter, but not in a bad way.  Sweet and juicy citrus fruits and candied sugar flavors.  Slightly mellow and on the lighter side.  No harshness at all, even when you want a little bit.  Simply delicious.

Growler sample via and shared with oakbluff. Hazy pale orange in colour (virtually identical to the Simcoe IPA), with medium carbonation. Heavy tropical fruit aromas, mixed with some blood orange and herbal grasses. Huge hops on the palate, with tropical and sweet citrus dominating, before taking on a leafy/grassy quality. Sturdy pale malts provide adequate balance. Medium bodied and fairly bitter. Definitely one of the better IIPAs Ive had recently.
Bottle courtesy GoT. Citrus nose, tangerine and grapefruit, but not as bright and fresh as could be. Toasty malts. Balanced tangy citrus finish.  Golden color.
Growler thanks to Chicago crew.  This stuff kicks ass aroma-wise. Plenty of pine, honey, wonderful.  Flavor is a bit more astringent in the bitterness, nice citrus, biscuity, dry, piney and flowery.

Served on-tap at Capones during the Hill Farmstead party during Philly Beer Week. Having had the regular version of Citra IPA I was dieing to try this version.

A - Pours murky orange with a nice pillow of one finger tall white head leaving spotty lacing down the glass.

S - Smells of strong, floral, citric hops throughout this one. Hints of tropical fruits, mostly grapefruit, and some light pine round out one awesome nose.

T - Huge blast of citric hops up front never really leaving the picture throughout the experience. Some strong grapefruit and mango flavors emerge once the hops die down a bit. Only the faintest trace of booze toward the end. Finish has plenty of lingering hop bitterness in it. Damn, this is one tasty hop bomb. Glad I got to try it!

M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Slick, hoppy, feel with plenty of bitterness lingering thru the finish.

O - I am not sure which I prefer, this one or the regular version. Either way both are excellent hop bombs. It is easy to drink and is packed with delicious hops. When it comes to hoppy beers it seems Hill Farmstead can do no wrong.

Bottle shared by Doug, thanks 
Appearance: Clear golden with a medium sized white head and some lacing 
Aroma: Floral and citrus 
Taste: Floral and fruity 
A very nice, easy drinking DIPA.

poured from a 2L growler. Pours a cloudy bright golden color with a large frothy head. Smell is instense of citrus rind, apricot and peaches. lots of tropical aromas. some bready malt and husk. taste is intense tropical hop flavors like mango citrus peach. Malt is sweet but moderate bitterness overstakes the sweetness. Mouthfeel is rich and full body kind of creamy. Overall a  very enjotable offering

Thanks to Doug for sharing this one.
Aroma: Huge Citra nose-Orange/Tangerine, hint of malt sweetness mixed in with the fruity nose
Taste: Touch grassy, tropical fruit from the hops, bready malts
This is a mellow DIPA, one of the best I have had. It had a firm bitterness that was not overpowering or offensive in any way.

Handbottle thanks to Toby. Pours a deep golden color with a medium white head. The aroma is a showcase of Citra; sweet marmalade, massive oranges and lemon. The flavor is a sweet fruity IPA, only light bitterness, no resin, just huge citrus orange goodness. A nice mellow malt balance. Nice. A very good brew.

growler from Hill Farmstead .....Hazy light amber pour ,  thin , rocky white head , excellent lace . Aroma is sweet and heavy with citrus fruit . Notes of grapefruit , mango and peach . Moderate hoppiness with excellent lingering tropical fruit notes . Bitter and dry finish , Medium bodied , soft carbonation . Fantastic

Hill farmstead double citra. Growler from a friend out east... Pours a partially golden orangey copper new penny brown and topped with a quickly forming soapy white head that quickly recedes towards the edges of the glass... Aroma is assertive on the citrus front, somewhat dank and fresh as newly used citra should be. Hoppy for sure with s lightly sweetened profile through the middle and finish... Flavors follow up nicely with a sweet tropical and citrus fruit bent.  
Tangerines and a mildy grassy bitterness mesh nicely. Well balanced with a nicely presented malt backbone which provides a genuine balance. A fair amount of bitterness in the finish with sweeter qualities through the middle. A touch of dankness in the finish. More Please.
9/4/8/4/16

UPDATED: APR 23, 2013 In short: A big uber-hoppy blonde IPA full of exotic and tropical fruits and way too easy to drink
How: Tap at the brewery
The look: Cloudy yellow-blonde body topped by a small white head
In long: Nose is classic Citra to me, which means tropical/exotic fruits and cat urine.  I just cant help it but get cat urine from any  heavily Citra-hopped beer.  Taste is big bed of fresh chewy cereals and a lot of exotic and tropical fruits and light notes of cheese.  The bitterness level is probably pretty high but the beer is never aggressive, this is not a biting harsh bitterness, it is round and only slightly resinous.  Overall this beer is as good as a Citra monster can be but there is something with me and Citra (cat urine) that prevents me from enjoying it as much as other Hill Farmstead double ipas.  But objectively, this is a great beer.  I dont know I seem to be the only one to notice cat urine aroma in Citra-hopped beers, maybe Im better at noticing things than any of you guys, I bet none of you has noticed that that the word "OK" looks like a little person lying on his side.
Lightly hazy golden orange with a big retained white head... huge aroma of orange grapefruit... livelyish, loads of citrus, decent body, quite drinkable, not very bitter, possibly some honey...

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2015 Draft. Pours an amber  color with lots of head. Aroma is very hoppy. Taste is bursting with grapefruit and other citruses. Has the distinct feeling that it?s almost juicy. Really great beer. Kicks your palates butt.

Growler shared by fred82, thank you! 
Incredbile hoppy aroma! Every citrus fruit under the sun! No pine notes here, its a citrus bomb. Flavor is just moremhops, but there are delicate as much as they are savage.
